email_content:
Hi Tom,

Thank you for reaching out and for the important work HopeBridge Foundation does. Below are a few evidence-based practices that have been effective for us at Westbrook University when supporting students with refugee backgrounds. I hope they’re helpful as you develop or enhance your own programs.

1. Language & Academic Skills Support
   • Offer flexible English-as-an-Additional-Language workshops that focus on the academic vocabulary students will encounter in their courses.
   • Provide writing-center appointments that are specifically staffed by tutors familiar with multilingual learners.

2. Mentorship & Advising
   • Pair each student with a faculty/staff mentor who checks in regularly, helps navigate administrative processes, and serves as a consistent point of contact.
   • Encourage near-peer mentoring by matching new arrivals with upper-year students who share a similar cultural or linguistic background.

3. Community Integration
   • Host informal social gatherings and discussion circles that allow students to share their experiences and build friendships across cultures.
   • Partner with local community organizations so students can engage in volunteer or internship opportunities that foster a sense of belonging beyond campus.

4. Holistic Well-Being
   • Coordinate with counseling services to ensure culturally sensitive support is available.
   • Schedule workshops on stress management, study strategies, and navigating campus resources.

5. Continuous Feedback & Adaptation
   • Conduct short, anonymous check-ins each term to understand emerging needs and adjust programming accordingly.
   • Invite student representatives to sit on planning committees so their voices directly shape services.

If it would be helpful, I’m happy to share sample syllabi for language workshops, mentor orientation materials, or assessment templates we use to track student progress.

Let me know if you’d like to set up a brief call to discuss any of these items in more depth. Looking forward to collaborating.

Warm regards,
Jane
Professor & Refugee Student Mentor
Westbrook University
